text: Tiryns () was an ancient Greek acropolis (city). The remains are in the Peloponnese, a large peninsula and region in southern Greece, near to Nauplion. Heinrich Schliemann excavated Tiryns in 1885 and 1886. Tiryns is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, listed with Mycenae. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:World Heritage Sites in Greece Category:Ancient Greek cities
title: Tiryns
